meanings.definition: To tell a lie or falsehood.
meanings.sent1: Tom tends to mislie about his homework completion.
meanings.sent2: It is not right to mislie about your actions.
meanings.sent3: The mislie about the missing cookies was quickly uncovered.
meanings.sent4: Her smile can mislie her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The detective could see through the mislie in the suspect's alibi.

meanings.sent1: The magician used sleight of hand to mislie the audience.
meanings.sent2: Don't let appearances mislie you; things are not always as they seem.
meanings.sent3: The mislie in the treasure map led the pirates on a wild goose chase.
meanings.sent4: The mirage in the desert mislied the travelers into thinking they were near an oasis.
meanings.sent5: His charming smile can mislie people into trusting him easily.

meanings.sent1: She could see through his mislie and knew the truth.
meanings.sent2: The mislie in the contract led to a legal dispute.
meanings.sent3: The mislie in the advertisement made customers skeptical.
meanings.sent4: His mislie was exposed when the evidence came to light.
meanings.sent5: The mislie caused confusion among the group members.
